content: Hey @Aman Arora -- tomorrow I'd like to discuss 'milestones' and dates a bit. I'm trying to setup my overall tracking for the remainder of the year of what I hope to get done and by when.

I guess that the milestones for this project are something like

  • Nightly implementation is feature complete (getting close, I think)
  • Migrations are feature complete
  • Migrations are tested in a crater run
  • Stabilized for the new edition in nightly
We could even create proper github milestones for that
Are there other stages that you can think of?

Migrations are tested in a crater run

I'm assuming this includes a possible increase in the closure size, auto traits, clone etc?
that could be the same crater run, or we could make distinct milestones for that
I think we might want to do the closure size separate from the rest

• Nightly implementation is feature complete (getting close, I think)
  • Migrations are feature complete
  • Migrations are tested in a crater run
  • Closure size is measured in a crater run
  • Stabilized for the new edition in nightly

Where would optimizations come in, if we have to after the closure size experiment? Is it like a feedback loop milestone, fix-test until threshold metrics met, or do we want to state that more explicitly? Otherwise looks good
Are Roxane and I in the wrong zoom room?
